text: [Protovis](http://vis.stanford.edu/protovis) was featured in [MIT Technology Review](http://www.technologyreview.com/computing/22927/).
Take a tour through the [Visualization Zoo](http://queue.acm.org/detail.cfm?id=1805128)!
[Protovis 3.2](http://vis.stanford.edu/protovis) has been released! New layouts, behaviors, and maps.
Jeff and Joe Hellerstein led a [Data Visualization tutorial](http://vldb2009.org/?q=node/17#1) at [VLDB 2009](http://vldb2009.org/).
[ACM Queue's interview](http://queue.acm.org/detail.cfm?id=1744741) with Jeff Heer, Martin Wattenberg and Fernanda Viégas.
Congrats to [Mike Bostock](http://graphics.stanford.edu/~mbostock), Stamen, and SimpleGeo on the release of [Polymaps](http://polymaps.org).
Four new papers at [InfoVis 2010](http://vis.computer.org/VisWeek2010/infovis/sessions_papers.html), including two best paper nominees!
Music fan? See Eddie Segel's [Pitchfork Year in Reviews](http://www.yearinreviews.com/).

Two [new](http://vis.stanford.edu/papers/wrangler) [papers](http://vis.stanford.edu/papers/commentspace) at CHI 2011, and [another](http://vis.stanford.edu/papers/mining-social-topologies) at IUI 2011.
Check out [Data Wrangler](http://vis.stanford.edu/wrangler), our new system for visual data cleaning and transformation!
SocialFlows was featured in [MIT Technology Review](http://technologyreview.com/communications/32394/page2/)!

[Wrangler](/wrangler) and [Protovis](/protovis), along with other data tools, were featured in [ComputerWorld](http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9215504/22_free_tools_for_data_visualization_and_analysis).
[Data-Driven Documents (D3)](http://vis.stanford.edu/d3) is our latest web-based visualization tool and the successor to [Protovis](http://vis.stanford.edu/protovis).
A flurry of research! Four new papers at [UIST 2011](http://www.acm.org/uist/uist2011/program/index.html), plus four more at [VisWeek 2011](http://visweek.org/visweek/2011/paper-session/all/all).

[D3](http://vis.stanford.edu/d3) was named the [#1 data visualization project of the year](http://flowingdata.com/2011/12/21/the-best-data-visualization-projects-of-2011/) by [Flowing Data](http://flowingdata.com/)!
Four new papers at [CHI 2012](http://chi2012.acm.org/).
The New York Times uses [D3](http://vis.stanford.edu/d3) to visualize [Obama's Budget Proposal](http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2012/02/13/us/politics/2013-budget-proposal-graphic.html).
Our article for ACM catalogs [Interactive Dynamics for Visual Analysis](http://queue.acm.org/detail.cfm?id=2146416).
Two new systems released: the [Datavore in-browser database](http://vis.stanford.edu/projects/datavore) and [C3 library for color naming models](http://vis.stanford.edu/color-names).
[Three](http://vis.stanford.edu/papers/graphprism) [new](http://vis.stanford.edu/papers/profiler) [papers](http://vis.stanford.edu/papers/termite) at AVI '12.
Jeff sat down for an [interview on Data Stories](http://datastori.es/episode-8-interview-jeff-heer/).
We discuss [Interactive Analysis of Big Data](http://xrds.acm.org/article.cfm?aid=2331058) in ACM XRDS.

At VisWeek 2012: studies of [slope judgments](http://vis.stanford.edu/papers/slope-ratio-comparison) (InfoVis) and [enterprise analysts](http://vis.stanford.edu/papers/enterprise-analysis-interviews) (VAST best paper nominee).
[D3.js](http://d3js.org) wins [Online News Association award](http://journalists.org/2013/10/19/guardian-boston-globe-axisphilly-texas-tribune-take-home-2013-online-journalism-awards/)!
UW, Berkeley, and NYU collaborate on [$37.8M data science initiative](http://news.cs.washington.edu/2013/11/12/uw-berkeley-nyu-collaborate-on-37-8m-data-science-initiative/).
The [Stanford Vis Group](http://vis.stanford.edu) is now the [UW Interactive Data Lab](http://idl.cs.washington.edu)! For updates, [follow us on Twitter at @uwdata](http://twitter.com/uwdata).
Join our [Language Learning, Visualization, and Interfaces workshop](http://nlp.stanford.edu/events/illvi2014/) at ACL 2014!
Join us at the [UW Data Science Seminar](http://data.uw.edu/seminar)!
Two new papers at [EuroVis 2014](http://eurovis.swansea.ac.uk/): [Lyra](/papers/lyra) and [Ellipsis](/papers/ellipsis).
[Watch Arvind present](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=io7BSu6RIYM) our [Lyra](/projects/lyra) system at OpenVisConf!

New papers on [perceptual design](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/perceptual-kernels/), [effects of latency](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/latency/), [declarative interaction](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/reactive-vega/), and [language](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/interactive-translation/) [translation](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/ptm/).

Jeff was selected as a [Moore Investigator in Data-Driven Discovery](http://www.moore.org/programs/science/data-driven-discovery/investigators)! Thanks to the Moore Foundation for their generous support.
[Come join us!](/positions) We're looking for talented PhD students and Post-Docs to join our group.
Diana's [analysis of addiction recovery in online forums](/papers/forum77) was selected as a Best Paper Honorable Mention at CSCW!
Watch Jeff's keynote talks at [Strata](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vc1bq0qIKoA) and [OpenVis Conf](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GdoDLuPe-Wg).

[Three](/papers/voyager)
[new](/papers/beyond-webers-law)
[papers](/papers/reactive-vega-architecture)
at [VIS 2015](http://ieeevis.org/)!
We started an [IDL blog](https://medium.com/@uwdata)!
Watch [Arvind](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y8Fp9z-9DWc) and [Jessica](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pTVAn4oLvbc) present at [OpenVis Conf 2016](https://openvisconf.com/).
Our [re-analysis of correlation perception data](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/beyond-webers-law/) won a best paper honorable mention at InfoVis 2015!
New papers at [InfoVis 2016](http://ieeevis.org/year/2016/info/call-participation/infovis-papers): [Vega-Lite](/papers/vega-lite) and [Surprise Maps](/papers/surprise-maps).
Jeff speaks about [Interactive Data Analysis](http://schedule.sxsw.com/2017/events/PP64388) at SXSW 2017.

[Five](papers/voyager2) [new](papers/graphscape) papers [at](papers/regression-by-eye) [CHI'17](papers/trust-but-verify), including [best paper](papers/explaining-the-gap) and [honorable mention](papers/graphscape) winners!
Papers at [EuroVis 2017](http://eurovis2017.virvig.es/): [reverse-engineering visualizations](papers/reverse-engineering-vis) and [chart sequencing strategies](papers/sequence-structure).
Watch Ham, Dom & Arvind present [Vega-Lite: A Grammar of Interactive Graphics](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9uaHRWj04D4) at OpenVis Conf 2017!

[Five](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/tfgraph/) [new](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/consistency/) [papers](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/others-expectations/) [at](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/imagining-replications/) [VIS'17](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/extracting-color-mappings/), including [VAST Best Paper](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/tfgraph/) and [InfoVis Honorable Mention](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/consistency/) award winners!

[Five](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/concrete-reexpression/) [new](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/uncertainty-bus/) [papers](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/quantitative-color/) [at](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/insitu-code-vis/) [CHI'18](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/uncertainty-palettes/)!

EuroVis'18 papers on [SetCoLa for custom graph layout](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/setcola/) and [the effects of task and data on visual encoding effectiveness](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/task-data-effectiveness/).

[Three](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/draco/) [new](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/hops-trends/) [papers](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/uncertainty-eval-survey/) at VIS'18, including an [InfoVis Best Paper Award for Draco](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/draco/)!
Catch our paper on the [Idyll language for interactive articles](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/idyll) at ACM UIST 2018!
[Two](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/falcon/) [papers](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/table-repair/) at CHI 2019!
IUI 2020 paper on [interactive learning for text sequences](/papers/iseql/).

New CHI papers on [responsive design](/papers/responsive-vis/), [analysis decisions](/papers/analysis-decision-points/), [vis recommenders](/papers/dziban), [query analysis](/papers/tempura), and [ML explainability](/papers/explain-feedback).
Congrats [Jane Hoffswell](https://homes.cs.washington.edu/~jhoffs/) et al. for a [CHI Best Paper Award](/papers/responsive-vis)!
Congrats [Tongshuang (Sherry) Wu](https://homes.cs.washington.edu/~wtshuang/) for her [ACL 2020 Best Paper on CheckList](https://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/check-list/)!
Congrats [Alex Kale](http://students.washington.edu/kalea/) et al. for a [VIS 2020 Best Paper Award](papers/effect-size-judgments/)!
Congrats (again) [Alex Kale](http://students.washington.edu/kalea/) et al. for a [VIS 2021 Best Paper Honorable Mention](papers/causal-support/)!
Our [Narrative Visualization](papers/narrative/) paper won an [InfoVis 10-Year Test-of-Time Award](http://ieeevis.org/year/2020/info/awards/test-of-time-awards).
IDL welcomes (back) [Leilani Battle](https://homes.cs.washington.edu/~leibatt/bio.html) as a UW CSE professor and lab co-director!
[D3](papers/d3) wins an [InfoVis 10-Year Test-of-Time Award](http://ieeevis.org/year/2021/info/awards/test-of-time-awards)!
[Tisane](papers/tisane) is a CHI'22 Honorable Mention. Congrats [Eunice](https://eunicemjun.com/)!
Our [interview study of data analysts](papers/enterprise-analysis-interviews) received a [10-Year Test-of-Time Award](https://ieeevis.org/year/2022/info/awards/test-of-time-awards).
[ScatterShot](papers/scattershot) earns an IUI'23 Honorable Mention.
Six new papers at VIS 2023!

Congrats to [Leilani Battle](https://homes.cs.washington.edu/~leibatt/bio.html) for the [2023 VGTC Significant New Researcher Award](https://ieeecs-media.computer.org/tc-media/sites/49/2023/10/09182427/award_visualization-significant-new-researcher-leilani.pdf)!
[Living Papers](papers/living-papers/) receives a UIST 2023 Honorable Mention.
[rTisane](papers/rtisane) wins a CHI 2024 Best Paper Award!
IDL alum [Dominik Moritz](https://www.domoritz.de/) won a [2024 VGTC Significant New Researcher Award](https://ieeevis.org/year/2024/program/awards/awards)!
